intro: Pourthiaea variabilis, commonly known as the variable pourthiaea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
